CVE-2009-0001.title: Apple QuickTime RTSP URL buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0001.body: Apple QuickTime is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when processing RTSP URLs. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted RTSP URL, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple QuickTime (7.6 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0004.title: Apple QuickTime MPEG-2 video files buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0004.body: Apple QuickTime is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when processing MPEG-2 video files containing MP3 audio content. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted movie file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple QuickTime (7.6 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0005.title: Apple QuickTime H.263 movie files code execution
CVE-2009-0005.body: Apple QuickTime could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error when processing H.263 encoded movie files. By persuading a victim to view a specially-crafted movie file, a remote attacker could corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple QuickTime (7.6 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0016.title: Apple iTunes DAAP denial of service
CVE-2009-0016.body: Apple iTunes is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper handling of Digital Audio Access Protocol (DAAP) messages. By sending a specially-crafted DAAP message containing a malicious Content-Length parameter in the header, a remote attacker could cause the application to enter into an infinite loop.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple iTunes (8.1 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0023.title: Apache APR-util apr_strmatch_precompile() denial of service
CVE-2009-0023.body: The APR-util in Apache is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by an integer underflow in the apr_strmatch_precompile() function in strmatch/apr_strmatch.c. An attacker can exploit this vulnerability to cause the application using the library to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of APR-util (1.3.5 or later), available from the Apache Web site. See References. For WebSphere Application Server 6.0: Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.0.2.37 or later) or APAR PK88341. See References. For WebSphere Application Server 6.1: Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.1.0.27 or later) or APAR PK88341. See References. For WebSphere Application Server 7.0: Apply the latest Fix Pack (7.0.0.7 or later) or APAR PK88341. See References. For IBM HTTP Server: Apply the Interim Fix for this vulnerability (APAR PK91361), available from IBM Support and Downloads Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2009-0026.title: Apache Jackrabbit search.jsp and swr.jsp cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0026.body: Apache Jackrabbit is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the search.jsp and swr.jsp scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the "q" parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Apache Jackrabbit (1.5.2 or later), available from the Apache Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0030.title: SquirrelMail session ID session hijacking
CVE-2009-0030.body: The SquirrelMail package included within Red Hat could allow a remote attacker to hijack a valid user's session, caused by an error in an earlier patch which creates multiple identical session IDs. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to hijack the victim's SquirrelMail session and possibly launch further attacks on the vulnerable system.Refer to SquirrelMail Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0033.title: Apache Tomcat AJP denial of service
CVE-2009-0033.body: Apache Tomcat is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper handling of header files by the Java AJP connector. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP header request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to block the mod_jk load balancer which temporarily blocks connectivity to the server.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the SVN repository. See References. For WebSphere Application Server Community Edition 2.1: Apply the latest Fix Pack (2.1.1.3 or later) or APAR PK95615. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-0037.title: cURL and libcurl CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION security bypass
CVE-2009-0037.body: cURL and libcurl could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error in the redirect implementation when CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION is enabled. By persuading a victim to transfer files from a malicious HTTP server that redirects to a FILE:// or SCP:// URL, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and read or overwrite arbitrary files, trigger arbitrary requests, or execute arbitrary commands.Upgrade to the latest version of cURL (7.19.4 or later), available from the cURL Web page. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-0040.title: libpng pointer arrays code execution
CVE-2009-0040.body: libpng could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by the improper initialization of specific pointer arrays before freeing array data structures. By sending a specially-crafted PNG file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system or cause a denial of service. Note: This vulnerability also affects various 3rd party applications that use the libpng library.For Apple Mac OS: Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References. For libpng: Upgrade to the latest version of libpng (1.0.43 or 1.2.35 or later), available from the LIBPNG Web page. See References. For Pngcrush: Upgrade to the latest version of Pngcrush (1.6.14 or later), available from SourceForge.net. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-0050.title: Multiple vendor OpenSSL DSA_verify() certificate chain validation security bypass
CVE-2009-0050.body: Multiple vendor applications that use the OpenSSL DSA_verify function could allow a remote attacker to bypass signature validation checks. Various functions within the OpenSSL library fail to properly check results returned by the DSA_verify function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malicious server or man-in-the-middle techniques to bypass digital signature certificate chain validation, and possibly gain unauthorized access to a vulnerable client.For Lasso: Upgrade to the latest version of Lasso (2.2.1 or later), available from the Lasso Web site. See References. For other distributions: Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2009-0051.title: Multiple vendor OpenSSL DSA_verify() certificate chain validation security bypass
CVE-2009-0051.body: Multiple vendor applications that use the OpenSSL DSA_verify function could allow a remote attacker to bypass signature validation checks. Various functions within the OpenSSL library fail to properly check results returned by the DSA_verify function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a malicious server or man-in-the-middle techniques to bypass digital signature certificate chain validation, and possibly gain unauthorized access to a vulnerable client.For Lasso: Upgrade to the latest version of Lasso (2.2.1 or later), available from the Lasso Web site. See References. For other distributions: Contact your vendor for patch or upgrade information. See References.

CVE-2009-0057.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager CAPF TCP session denial of service
CVE-2009-0057.body: Cisco Unified Communications Manager could allow a remote attacker to cause a denial of service, caused by improper handling of malformed data by the Certificate Authority Proxy Function (CAPF) service. By sending specially-crafted data to TCP port 3804, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to terminate client connections, resulting in a denial of service.Refer to cisco-sa-20090121-cucmcapf for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0063.title: Symantec Brightmail Gateway Appliance Control Center cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0063.body: Symantec Brightmail Gateway Appliance is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Brightmail Control Center management console. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to SYM09-005 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0106.title: PHPAuctions profile.php and active_auctions.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0106.body: PHPAuctions is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the profile.php or active_auctions.php script using the user_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0112.title: Poll Pro agent_edit.asp cross-site request forgery
CVE-2009-0112.body: Poll Pro is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the agent_edit.asp script. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to cause the victim to perform arbitrary tasks. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning and other malicious activities.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0123.title: Apple Safari RSS feed information disclosure
CVE-2009-0123.body: Apple Safari could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper handling of Safari RSS feeds. By persuading a victim to click on a specially-crafted URL, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain passwords, cookies or other sensitive information.Refer to Apply Security Update 2009-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-0141.title: Apple Mac OS X Xterm information disclosure
CVE-2009-0141.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information. Xterm, when used with "luit", creates TTY devices with world-writable and world-readable permissions. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to send and write data to another user's Xterm.Apply Apple Security Update 2009-001, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0143.title: Apple iTunes podcast information disclosure
CVE-2009-0143.body: Apple iTunes could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by a design flaw in the podcast feature. A remote attacker could use an authentication dialog, presented during a malicious podcast, to persuade a victim to send iTunes credentials to a podcast server and obtain sensitive information.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple iTunes (8.1 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0145.title: Apple Mac OS X CoreGraphics PDF code execution
CVE-2009-0145.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by multiple memory corruption errors in CoreGraphics. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PDF file, an attacker could execute code with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-0149.title: Apple Mac OS X disk images code execution variant 1
CVE-2009-0149.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by multiple memory corruption errors when mounting disk images. By persuading a victim to mount a specially-crafted sparse disk image, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0150.title: Apple Mac OS X disk images buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0150.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when mounting disk images. By persuading a victim to mount a specially-crafted sparse disk image, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0153.title: Apple Mac OS X International Components for Unicode security bypass
CVE-2009-0153.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error in the International Components for Unicode implementation when handing certain character encodings. ICU converts invalid byte sequences to Unicode which may result in over-consumption, where trailing bytes are considered part of the original character. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass filters which could be leveraged to possibly launch cross-site scripting attacks.Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-0154.title: Apple Mac OS X Apple Type Services Compact Font Format (CFF) fonts buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0154.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by Apple Type Services when handling Compact Font Format (CFF) fonts. By persuading a victim to open a document containing specially-crafted CFF fonts, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0155.title: Apple Mac OS X CoreGraphics PDF buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0155.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by an integer underflow in CoreGraphics. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PDF file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0156.title: Apple Mac OS X Launch Services denial of service
CVE-2009-0156.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to a denial of service caused by an out-of-bounds memory read access error in Launch Services. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted Mach-O executable, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the Finder to repeatedly terminate and relaunch.Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0157.title: Apple Mac OS X CFNetwork buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0157.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by CFNetwork. By sending overly long HTTP headers, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0159.title: NTP cookedprint() buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0159.body: NTP is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the cookedprint() function. By persuading a victim to query a specially-crafted time server with ntpq, a remote attacker using a malicious server response could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of NTP (4.2.4p7-RC2 or later), available from the NTP Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-0161.title: Apple Mac OS X OpenSSL::OCSP weak security
CVE-2009-0161.body: Apple Mac OS X could provide weaker than expected security. The OpenSSL::OCSP Ruby module may interpret an invalid response as an OCSP validation of the certificate. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to launch further attacks against the system.Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0165.title: Multiple products JBIG2 unspecified
CVE-2009-0165.body: An integer overflow in the JBIG2 decoder in multiple products, including Xpdf and Poppler when running on Mac OS X, has an unknown impact.For Apple Mac OS: Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References. Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-0169.title: Sun Java System Access Manager sub-realm administrator privilege escalation
CVE-2009-0169.body: An unspecified error in Sun Java System Access Manager could allow a remote attacker gain elevated privileges on the system. An attacker with sub-realm administrator privileges could exploit this vulnerability by creating the amadmin account in the sub-realm to access the root realm as an administrator.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 249106 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0170.title: Sun Java System Access Manager password information disclosure
CVE-2009-0170.body: Sun Java System Access Manager could allow a remote authenticated attacker with privileges to access the administration console to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unknown attack vectors to obtain password information.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 242166 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0175.title: MP3 TrackMaker .mp3 buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0175.body: MP3 TrackMaker is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by .mp3 files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .mp3 file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0182.title: VUPlayer .pls file line buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0182.body: VUPlayer is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when processing a .pls file. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .pls file containing an overly long URL in a file line, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0185.title: Apple QuickTime MS ADPCM buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0185.body: Apple QuickTime is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when handling MS ADPCM encoded audio data. By persuading a victim to view a specially-crafted movie file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple QuickTime (7.6.2 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0187.title: Orbit Downloader Connecting buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0187.body: Orbit Downloader is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when generating the "Connecting" log message. By persuading a victim to download from a malicious HTTP server or to click a specially-crafted HTTP URL containing an overly long name, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Orbit Downloader (2.8.5 or later), available from the Orbit Downloader Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0191.title: Foxit Reader JBIG2 code execution
CVE-2009-0191.body: Foxit Reader could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error when processing JBIG2 symbol dictionary segments. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PDF file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to dereference uninitialized memory and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Foxit Reader (3.0 Build 1506 or 2.3 Build 3902 or later), available from the Foxit Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0192.title: Novell eDirectory iMonitor Accept-Language buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0192.body: Novell eDirectory is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by an off-by-one error in the iMonitor component when processing HTTP requests. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP request containing a malicious Accept-Language header, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Refer to Novell Document ID: 3426981 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0194.title: Garmin Communicator Plug-In ActiveX control domain security bypass
CVE-2009-0194.body: The Garmin Communicator Plug-In ActiveX control (npGarmin.dll) could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could bypass the domain locking and dialog box to read and delete sensitive data from the Garmin GPS device.Upgrade to the latest version of Garmin Communicator Plug-In ActiveX control (2.7.3 or later), available from the Garmin Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0197.title: IrfanView Formats Plug-in XPM file buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0197.body: IrfanView Formats Plug-in is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by an integer overflow when handling XPM files. By persuading a victim to open an XPM file containing specially-crafted dimensions, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of the Formats Plug-in (4.23 or later), available from the IrfanView Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0198.title: Adobe Acrobat and Reader JBIG2 code execution
CVE-2009-0198.body: Adobe Acrobat and Reader could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an unspecified memory corruption error in the JBIG2 filter. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PDF file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service, corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Refer to APSB09-07 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-0202.title: Microsoft PowerPoint Freelance Windows buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0202.body: Microsoft PowerPoint is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by an array-indexing error in the Microsoft PowerPoint Freelance Windows 2.1 Translator (FL21WIN.DLL) when parsing layout information. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted Freelance file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References. — OR — Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2009-0204.title: HP OpenView Select Access unspecified cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0204.body: HP OpenView Select Access is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to HPSBMA02403 SSRT090007 rev.1 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0215.title: IBM Access Support ActiveX control buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0215.body: The IBM Access Support ActiveX control (IbmEgath.dll) is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page that passes overly long arguments to the GetXMLValue() method, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim or cause the victim's browser to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0238.title: Microsoft Excel unspecified code execution
CVE-2009-0238.body: Microsoft Excel could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by the improper parsing of Excel spreadsheets. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted Excel spreadsheet, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References. — OR — Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2009-0240.title: WebSVN listing.php information disclosure
CVE-2009-0240.body: WebSVN, when used with an SVN authz file, could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error in the listing.php script. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the repname parameter to read changelogs and other restricted information.Upgrade to the latest version of WebSVN (2.1.0 or later), available from the WebSVN Web page. See References.

CVE-2009-0244.title: HTC OBEX FTP directory traversal
CVE-2009-0244.body: HTC devices running Microsoft Windows Mobile could allow a remote authenticated attacker to traverse directories on the system caused by an error in obexfile.dll. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the OBEX FTP server containing "dot dot" sequences using forward-slash or backslash characters (../ or ..\) to traverse directories and upload files to folders or download files or directories outside the default Bluetooth shared folder.Apply the hotfix for this vulnerability, available from the HTC Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0247.title: 53KF Web IM msg parameter cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0247.body: 53KF Web IM is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the msg parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0248.title: RankEm siteID cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0248.body: RankEm is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the rankup.asp script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an HTML META tag in the siteID parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0248.title: RankEm rankup.asp cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0248.body: RankEm is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the rankup.asp script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the siteID parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0249.title: RankEm topsites.mdb information disclosure
CVE-2009-0249.body: RankEm could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper restrictions on the topsites.mdb file stored inside the Web root. By sending a direct request, a remote attacker could obtain database credentials and other sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0250.title: phoSheezy config/password information disclosure
CVE-2009-0250.body: phoSheezy could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. The config/password file is stored within the Web document root directory with insecure permissions. An attacker could send a direct request for this file to obtain user credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0252.title: eReservations Login.asp SQL injection
CVE-2009-0252.body: eReservations is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the Login.asp script using the Login or Password parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0257.title: TYPO3 Workspace module cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0257.body: TYPO3 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Workspace module. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to TYPO3-SA-2009-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0257.title: TYPO3 Indexed Search Engine cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0257.body: TYPO3 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Indexed Search Engine system extension, the ADOdb system extension and the Workspace module. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the name and file content in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to TYPO3-SA-2009-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0257.title: TYPO3 authentication library session hijacking
CVE-2009-0257.body: TYPO3 could allow a remote attacker to hijack a valid user's session, caused by the improper validation of session tokens. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to hijack the victim's session and possibly launch further attacks on the vulnerable system.Refer to TYPO3-SA-2009-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0258.title: TYPO3 Indexed Search Engine command execution
CVE-2009-0258.body: TYPO3 could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by the improper validation of input passed to the Indexed Search Engine system extension prior to being used to call commands. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary commands on the system.Refer to TYPO3-SA-2009-001 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0259.title: OpenOffice.org Word processor code execution
CVE-2009-0259.body: OpenOffice.org could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error in the Word processor. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .doc, .wri, or .rtf Word 97 file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory, execute arbitrary code on the system, or cause a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenOffice.org (2.0 or later), available from the OpenOffice.org Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0260.title: MoinMoin AttachFile.py cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0260.body: MoinMoin is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the AttachFile.py script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using multiple parameters in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Apply the fix for this vulnerability, available from the MoinMoin Mercurial Repository. See References.

CVE-2009-0261.title: Total Video Player DefaultSkin.ini buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0261.body: Total Video Player is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by DefaultSkin.ini. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted media file containing an overly long ColumnHeaderSpan value, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0264.title: Fujitsu SystemcastWizard Lite unspecified buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0264.body: An unspecified error in the Registry Setting Tool in Fujitsu SystemcastWizard Lit could allow a remote attacker to overflow a buffer and possibly execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (SystemcastWizard Lite Patch), available from the FUJITSU Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0269.title: Linux Kernel readlink denial of service
CVE-2009-0269.body: Linux Kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the eCryptfs subsystem. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a readlink call, which results in the use of an incorrect return value as an array index, to corrupt memory and cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Linux Kernel (2.6.28.1 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0278.title: Sun Java System Application Server WEB-INF and META-INF information disclosure
CVE-2009-0278.body: An unspecified vulnerability in Sun Java System Application Server could allow a remote attacker to read configuration files in the WEB-INF and META-INF directories.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 245446 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0279.title: Pardal CMS comentar.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0279.body: Pardal CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the comentar.php script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0281.title: The Walking Club login.aspx SQL injection
CVE-2009-0281.body: The Walking Club is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the login.aspx script using the txtEmail or txtPWD parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0285.title: BBSXP error.asp cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0285.body: BBSXP is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the error.asp script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the message parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0288.title: TFTPUtil TFTP Get directory traversal
CVE-2009-0288.body: TFTPUtil could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted TFTP GET request containing directory traversal sequences to traverse directories and download arbitrary files outside of the TFTP root directory.Upgrade to the latest version of TFTPUtil (1.4.0 or later), available from SourceForge.net. See References.

CVE-2009-0302.title: PHP-Nuke URI SQL Injection
CVE-2009-0302.body: PHP-Nuke is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements using a URI, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of October 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0302.title: Downloads module for PHP-Nuke modules.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0302.body: The Downloads module for PHP-Nuke is vulnerable to SQL injection. If magic_quotes_gpc is disabled and register_globals is enabled, a remote authenticated attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the modules.php script using the url parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0311.title: EMC AutoStart Backbone Engine code execution
CVE-2009-0311.body: EMC AutoStart could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper validation by the Backbone Engine (ftbackbone.exe) when processing DWORD values. By sending a specially-crafted packet to TCP Port 8042, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system with SYSTEM level privileges.Upgrade to the latest version of EMC AutoStart (5.3 SP2 or later), available from the EMC Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0312.title: MoinMoin antispam.py cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0312.body: MoinMoin is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the antispam.py script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Apply the fix for this vulnerability, available from the MoinMoin Mercurial Repository. See References.

CVE-2009-0323.title: Amaya HTML tags buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0323.body: Amaya is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the EndOfXmlAttributeValue(), EndOfStartGI(), and the ProcessStartGI() functions when processing input HTML tags. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page with an overly long type parameter in an HTML tag, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Amaya (11.1 or later), available from the W3C Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0324.title: BibCiter projects.php, contacts.php and users.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0324.body: BibCiter is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the projects.php, contacts.php or users.php script using the idp, idc or idu parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0326.title: Dark Age CMS login.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0326.body: Dark Age CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the login.php script using the username or password post parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0328.title: Digital Sales IPN Sales.mdb information disclosure
CVE-2009-0328.body: Digital Sales IPN could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper restrictions on the Sales.mdb file stored inside the Web root. By downloading the file, a remote attacker could obtain the admin username and password and other sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0329.title: PcCookBook component for Joomla! recipe_id SQL injection
CVE-2009-0329.body: The PcCookBook component for Joomla! is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the recipe_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.As a workaround for this vulnerability, uninstall the affected component.

CVE-2009-0330.title: SCMS index.php file include
CVE-2009-0330.body: Simple Content Management System (SCMS) could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the "p" parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0331.title: eSPG comment.php directory traversal
CVE-2009-0331.body: eSPG (Enhanced Simple PHP Gallery) could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the comment.php script containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the file parameter to view arbitrary files on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0332.title: AV Book Library edit.php, add.php and book_search.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0332.body: AV Book Library is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the edit.php, add.php or book_search.php script using various parameters, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of AV Book Library (1.1 or later), available from SourceForge.net: Files. See References.

CVE-2009-0334.title: BlogIt! index.asp SQL injection
CVE-2009-0334.body: BlogIt! is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.asp script using the day parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0335.title: BlogIt! index.asp cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0335.body: BlogIt! is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.asp script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the style parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0336.title: BlogIt! Blog.mdb information disclosure
CVE-2009-0336.body: BlogIt! could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper restrictions on the Blog.mdb file stored inside the Web root. By sending a direct request, a remote attacker could obtain database credentials and other sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0338.title: DMXReady Blog Manager inc_webblogmanager.asp cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0338.body: DMXReady Blog Manager is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the inc_webblogmanager.asp script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the CategoryID parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to the DMXReady Support Forum posting dated 17 Jan 2009 12:51 PM for upgrade and suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0339.title: DMXReady Blog Manager inc_webblogmanager.asp SQL injection
CVE-2009-0339.body: DMXReady Blog Manager is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the inc_webblogmanager.asp script using the ItemID parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to the DMXReady Support Forum posting dated 17 Jan 2009 12:51 PM for upgrade and suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0340.title: Simple PHP Newsletter mail.php and mailbar.php file include
CVE-2009-0340.body: Simple PHP Newsletter could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the mail.php or mailbar.php script using the olang parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0344.title: Sun Fire Embedded Lights Out Manager unauthorized network access
CVE-2009-0344.body: Sun Fire Server could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the network, caused by multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the Embedded Lights Out Manager (ELOM) software. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and execute arbitrary commands on the Service Processor (SP).Refer to Sun Alert ID: 239886 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0345.title: Sun Fire Embedded Lights Out Manager unauthorized network access
CVE-2009-0345.body: Sun Fire Server could allow a remote attacker to gain unauthorized access to the network, caused by multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the Embedded Lights Out Manager (ELOM) software. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and execute arbitrary commands on the Service Processor (SP).Refer to Sun Alert ID: 239886 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0346.title: Sun Solaris IP-in-IP denial of service
CVE-2009-0346.body: The Sun Solaris Internet Protocol (ip(7P)) Kernel Module is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper handling of packets. By sending a specially-crafted IP-in-IP self-encapsulated packet that lacks IPsec protection, a local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a system panic, resulting in a denial of service.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 240086 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0351.title: WinFTP Server LIST buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0351.body: WinFTP Server is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when processing the LIST command. By sending a LIST command beginning with an * (asterisk) character, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the server to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0363.title: BarnOwl and owl zcrypt buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0363.body: BarnOwl and owl are vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows. By sending a specially-crafted zcrypt message or a reply command on a message with a Zephyr Cc: list, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of BarnOwl (1.0.5 or later), available from the BarnOwl Web page. See References.

CVE-2009-0365.title: NetworkManager D-Bus request information disclosure
CVE-2009-0365.body: NetworkManager could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper enforcement of permissions when responding to D-Bus requests. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using D-Bus queries to obtain network connection passwords and pre-shared keys.For Ubuntu: Refer to USN-721-1 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0367.title: Wesnoth PythonAI code execution
CVE-2009-0367.body: Wesnoth could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by the improper importation of restricted python modules by specific white-listed python modules within PythonAI. By persuading a victim to download a specially-crafted add-on, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary Python code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Wesnoth (1.5.11 or later), available from the Wesnoth Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0368.title: OpenSC PKCS#11 implementation unauthorized access
CVE-2009-0368.body: OpenSC could allow a local attacker to gain unauthorized access to the system, caused by the improper storing of restricted data by the PKCS#11 implementation. A local attacker with access to the smartcard reader could exploit this vulnerability using the opensc-explorer or opensc-tool debugging tools to gain access to private data without having proper authentication.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenSC (0.11.7 or later), available from the OpenSC Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0371.title: SiteXS CMS type parameter file include
CVE-2009-0371.body: SiteXS CMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request using the type parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0372.title: MemHT Portal avatar file upload
CVE-2009-0372.body: MemHT Portal could allow a remote attacker to upload arbitrary files, caused by the improper validation of file types by the avatar upload feature of the profile editor. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP header containing a MIME media type, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to upload a malicious PHP script, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary PHP code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of MemHT Portal (4.0.1 or later), available from the MemHT Portal Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0373.title: Flash Magazine Deluxe component for Joomla! index.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0373.body: The Flash Magazine Deluxe component for Joomla! is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the mag_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.As a workaround for this vulnerability, uninstall the affected component.

CVE-2009-0375.title: RealNetworks RealPlayer IVR filename length buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0375.body: RealNetworks RealPlayer is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of filename lengths when processing Internet Video Recording (IVR) files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted IVR file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Refer to RealNetworks Web Site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0376.title: RealNetworks RealPlayer IVR modified field code execution
CVE-2009-0376.body: RealNetworks RealPlayer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error when parsing an unspecified modified field in an Internet Video Recording (IVR) file. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted IVR file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system.Refer to RealNetworks Web Site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0379.title: Prince Clan Chess Club component for Joomla! game_id parameter SQL injection
CVE-2009-0379.body: The Prince Clan Chess Club component for Joomla! is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the game_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.As a workaround for this vulnerability, uninstall the affected component.

CVE-2009-0383.title: Max.Blog delete.php security bypass
CVE-2009-0383.body: Max.Blog could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper restrictions to the delete.php script. By sending a specially-crafted POST request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to delete arbitrary posts from the vulnerable system.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (security_fix.zip), available from the max.blog Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0397.title: GStreamer Good Plug-ins qtdemux_parse_samples() buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0397.body: GStreamer Good Plug-ins is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the qtdemux_parse_samples() function in qtdemux.c when parsing the Time-to-sample (stss) atom. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted QuickTime media .mov file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of GStreamer (0.10.12 or later), available from the GStreamer GIT Repository. See References.

CVE-2009-0400.title: SocialEngine blog.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0400.body: SocialEngine is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the blog.php script using the category_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0402.title: Domain Technologie Control new_account.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0402.body: Domain Technologie Control is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the client/new_account.php script using various parameters, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Domain Technologie Control (0.29.16 or later), available from freshmeat.net. See References.

CVE-2009-0403.title: Chipmunk Blog authenticate.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0403.body: Chipmunk Blog is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the admin/authenticate.php script using the username or password parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0404.title: htmLawed unspecified cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0404.body: htmLawed is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of htmLawed (1.1.4 or later), available from the htmLawed Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0405.title: smartSite CMS articles.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0405.body: smartSite CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the articles.php script using the var parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0407.title: PHP-CMS login.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0407.body: PHP-CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the login.php script using the username parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0408.title: osCommerce unspecified cross-site request forgery
CVE-2009-0408.body: osCommerce is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the login.php script. By persuading an authenticated victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to cause the victim to add administrative accounts and perform other arbitrary tasks. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning and other malicious activities.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0411.title: Google Chrome XMLHttpRequest information disclosure
CVE-2009-0411.body: Google Chrome could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by insecure restrictions on the Set-Cookie and Set-Cookie2 HTTP response headers. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized access to the victim's cookies using the XMLHttpRequest calls.Upgrade to the latest version of Google Chrome (1.0.154.46 or later), available from the Google Chrome Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0419.title: Microsoft XML Core Services HTTPOnly Set-Cookie2 HTTP response headers information disclosure
CVE-2009-0419.body: Microsoft XML Core Services could allow a remote attacker to bypass HTTPOnly restrictions and obtain sensitive information, caused by improper handling of Set-Cookie2 HTTP response headers. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web site using Internet Explorer, a remote attacker could bypass security restrictions using XMLHttpRequest calls and obtain sensitive information from the victim's cookies. Note: It has been reported that this vulnerability exists due to an incomplete fix issued with Microsoft Security Bulletin MS08-069.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0421.title: Eventing component for Joomla! index.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0421.body: The Eventing component for Joomla! is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the catid parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0422.title: phpList admin/index.php file include
CVE-2009-0422.body: phpList could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. If register_globals is disabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the admin/index.php script using the _SERVER[ConfigFile] parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.Upgrade to the latest version of phpList (2.10.9 or later), available from the phpList Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0423.title: PHP Photo Album index.php file include
CVE-2009-0423.body: PHP Photo Album could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the preview parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0424.title: AN Guestbook sign1.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0424.body: AN Guestbook is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the sign1.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the country parameter to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of AN Guestbook (0.7.7 or later), available from SourceForge.net: Files. See References.

CVE-2009-0428.title: DMXReady Secure Document Library upload_image_category.asp SQL injection
CVE-2009-0428.body: DMXReady Secure Document Library is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the upload_image_category.asp script using the cid parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to the DMXReady Support Forum posting dated 17 Jan 2009 12:51 PM for upgrade and suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0434.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server PMI log file information disclosure
CVE-2009-0434.body: WebSphere Application Server could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information. If the Performance Monitoring Infrastructure (PMI) is enabled, the PMI may write sensitive information in the Systemout.log and ffdc files. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the system.For WebSphere Application Server 6.0.2: Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.0.2.31 or later) or APAR PK63886. See References. For WebSphere Application Server 6.1: Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.1.0.21 or later) or APAR PK63886. See References.

CVE-2009-0436.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server HTTP AF_UNIX sockets incorrect permissions
CVE-2009-0436.body: The mod_ibm_ssl and mod_cgid modules used by the WebSphere Application Server HTTP Server component, when running on AIX and HP-UX, creates AF_UNIX sockets with incorrect permissions. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unspecified attack vectors to have an unknown impact on the system.For WebSphere Application Server 6.0.2: Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.0.2.31 or later) or APAR PK66154. See References. For WebSphere Application Server 6.1: Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.1.0.19 or later) or APAR PK66154. See References. ——OR—— As a workaround, create a directory to contain UNIX sockets for the server and allow access only to root and the Web server user ID. Use the ScriptSock and SSLCachePortFilename directives to place the mod_cgid and mod_ibm_ssl sockets in this new directory.

CVE-2009-0437.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server installation log information disclosure
CVE-2009-0437.body: WebSphere Application Server 6.0.2, when installed on Windows, could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information. When using the Installation Factory to install WebSphere Application Server, sensitive information might appear in the log file, if the user chooses to create a profile and register the WebSphere Application Server as a Windows service. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the system.As an interim fix, upgrade to the October 4, 2008 version or newer of the installation factory or APAR PK67405. See References. ——OR—— As a workaround, delete the log file after the installation is completed. The file can be found under <WAS_HOME>/logs/instconfigifwas6.log

CVE-2009-0438.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server JSP Windows information disclosure
CVE-2009-0438.body: WebSphere Application Server, when running on Windows, could potentially allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. By sending a specially-crafted request, an attacker could bypass security restrictions and gain unauthorized access to JSP pages that rely on Authorization checking.Apply the latest Fix Pack (7.0.0.1 or later) or APAR PK75248. See References.

CVE-2009-0439.title: IBM WebSphere MQ queue manager privilege escalation
CVE-2009-0439.body: The WebSphere MQ queue manager could allow a local attacker to gain elevated MQ privileges on the system, caused by a vulnerability in the setmqaut, dmpmqaut, and dspmqaut authorization commands. This vulnerability can only be exploited with the ability to log in to a user account on the machine hosting the WebSphere MQ queue manager. This level of log in access is expected to be tightly controlled in a production environment. Note: Only those versions of WebSphere MQ running on UNIX operating systems are vulnerable to this issue.For WebSphere MQ 6.0: Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.0.2.6 or later) or APAR IZ40824. See References. For WebSphere MQ 7.0: Apply the latest Fix Pack (7.0.0.2 or later) or APAR IZ40824. See References.

CVE-2009-0440.title: IBM WebSphere Partner Gateway RNIF signature verification bypass
CVE-2009-0440.body: WebSphere Partner Gateway (WPG) fails to properly verify inbound RNIF (RosettaNet) document signatures. This could be exploited by a remote attacker with valid authentication credentials to bypass signature verification and pass potential malicious documents to the back-end application.Apply the iFix for this vulnerability (JR31231), available from IBM Support & downloads. See References.

CVE-2009-0445.title: DreamPics Builder exhibition_id SQL injection
CVE-2009-0445.body: DreamPics Builder is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the exhibition_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0448.title: Syntax Desktop preview.php file include
CVE-2009-0448.body: Syntax Desktop could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the preview.php script using the synTarget parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0450.title: BlazeVideo HDTV Player PLF buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0450.body: BlazeVideo HDTV Player is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of PLF files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PLF file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0454.title: Online Notebook Manager login SQL injection
CVE-2009-0454.body: Online Notebook Manager is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements using the username or password login fields, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0455.title: glFusion lib-comment.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0455.body: glFusion is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the lib-comment.php script. If anonymous comments are enabled, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the username field to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to the glFusion News posting dated Thursday, February 05 2009 @ 07:54 AM CST for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0487.title: Mahara unspecified cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0487.body: Mahara is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using forum posts to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the post is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Mahara (1.0.9 or later), available from the Mahara Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0493.title: IT!CMS login.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0493.body: IT!CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the login.php script using the Username parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0496.title: Openfire muc-room-edit-form.jsp cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0496.body: Openfire is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the muc-room-edit-form.jsp script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the roomconfig_roomname and roomconfig_roomdesc parameters to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, when the malicious chat room information is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Openfire (3.6.3 or later), when it is available from the Ignite Realtime Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0496.title: Openfire server-properties.jsp cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0496.body: Openfire is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the server-properties.jsp script. If "save" is set to a value that is not NULL, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the propName form parameter to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, when the malicious property name is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Openfire (3.6.3 or later), when it is available from the Ignite Realtime Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0496.title: Openfire multiple scripts cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0496.body: Openfire is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the logviewer.jsp, group-summary.jsp, user-properties.jsp, audit-policy.jsp and log.jsp scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the log, search, username, logDir, logTimeout, maxDays, maxFileSize and maxTotalSize parameters in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Openfire (3.6.3 or later), when it is available from the Ignite Realtime Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0497.title: Openfire log.jsp directory traversal
CVE-2009-0497.body: Openfire could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the log.jsp script containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the log parameter to view any .log files on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Openfire (3.6.3 or later), when it is available from the Ignite Realtime Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-0504.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server WSPolicy information disclosure
CVE-2009-0504.body: WebSphere Application Server could potentially allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information. When using Web Services and the client is using a WSPolicy of ProviderOnly (server policy is used to configure the client) and using a simple UserNameToken policyset with the binding property com.ibm.wsspi.wssecurity.token/IDAssertion.isUsed set to true, WSPolicy might ignore this and put sensitive information into the SOAP message. This could allow the client to access information that was not intended to be sent.Apply the latest Fix Pack (7.0.0.1 or later) or APAR PK73573. See References. ——OR—— As a workaround, add the "NoPassword" property to the token generator element in the bindings.

CVE-2009-0508.title: IBM WebSphere Application Server Web-based applications security bypass
CVE-2009-0508.body: WebSphere Application Server could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions. Web-based applications, including Web services applications running on WebSphere Application Server, could disclose application specific files contained within the war file, including files under the web-inf and meta-inf directories. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to view or execute files on the server contained within the war file. This vulnerability also affects the WebSphere administrative console when administrative security is disabled. Reported By: Edward SchallerFor WebSphere Application Server 6.0.2: Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.0.2.35 or later) or APAR PK81387. See References. For WebSphere Application Server 6.1: Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.1.0.23 or later) or APAR PK81387. See References. For WebSphere Application Server 7.0: Apply the latest Fix Pack (7.0.0.3 or later) or APAR PK81387. See References.

CVE-2009-0509.title: Adobe Acrobat and Reader Text Region buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0509.body: Adobe Acrobat and Reader are vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by a memory corruption vulnerability due to failure to adequately check integers read from the Text Region of the JBIG segments embedded in the file. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PDF file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Refer to Adobe Security Bulletin APSB09-07 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0515.title: Yet Another NOCC (YANOCC) check_lang.php file include
CVE-2009-0515.body: Yet Another NOCC (YANOCC) could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the check_lang.php script using the lang parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0516.title: BusinessSpace index.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-0516.body: BusinessSpace is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-0519.title: Adobe Flash Player unspecified SWF file denial of service
CVE-2009-0519.body: Adobe Flash Player is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an unspecified error when handling SWF files. By persuading a victim to load a specially-crafted SWF file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service and possibly execute arbitrary code on the system.For Apple Mac OS: Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References. Refer to APSB09-01 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-0520.title: Adobe Flash Player invalid object reference buffer overflow
CVE-2009-0520.body: Adobe Flash Player is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking related to an invalid object reference. By persuading a victim to load a specially-crafted SWF file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim or cause the application to crash.For Apple Mac OS: Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References. Refer to APSB09-01 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-0521.title: Adobe Flash Player unspecified information disclosure
CVE-2009-0521.body: An unspecified error in Adobe Flash Player binary when running on Linux could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information using unknown attack vectors.Refer to APSB09-01 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-0523.title: Adobe RoboHelp Server errors log cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-0523.body: Adobe RoboHelp Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked.
