CVE-2009-1023.body: phpComasy is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements using the entry_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1024.title: PHPLinkAdmin edlink.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-1024.body: PHPLinkAdmin is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the edlink.php script using the linkid parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1027.title: OpenCart order parameter SQL injection
CVE-2009-1027.body: OpenCart is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the order parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenCart (1.1.9 or later), available from the OpenCart Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1028.body: eZip Wizard is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when processing .zip compressed files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .zip file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1029.title: POP Peeper Date buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1029.body: POP Peeper is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when processing Date responses. By persuading a victim to connect to a malicious mail server, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted Date header containing an overly long string to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1030.title: WordPress MU wpmu-functions.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1030.body: WordPress MU is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the wpmu-functions.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the HTTP Host header to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of WordPress MU (2.7 or later), available from the WordPress multi-user (MU) Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1031.title: Serv-U FTP Server MKD command directory traversal
CVE-2009-1031.body: Serv-U FTP Server could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. A remote authenticated attacker could send a specially-crafted MKD request containing "dot dot" sequences (\..\) to create arbitrary directories on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1032.title: YABSoft Advanced Image Hosting Script gallery_list.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-1032.body: YABSoft Advanced Image Hosting Script is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the gallery_list.php script using the gal parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1033.title: DeluxeBB qorder SQL injection
CVE-2009-1033.body: DeluxeBB is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to misc.php script using the qorder parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1034.title: Tasklist module for Drupal unspecified SQL injection
CVE-2009-1034.body: The Tasklist module for Drupal is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to an unspecified script using values in the URI, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to DRUPAL-SA-CONTRIB-2009-011 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1035.title: Tasklist module for Drupal CSS pages cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1035.body: The Tasklist module for Drupal is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using CSS pages to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the CSS data is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to DRUPAL-SA-CONTRIB-2009-011 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1036.title: Plus 1 module for Drupal unspecified cross-site request forgery
CVE-2009-1036.body: The Plus 1 module for Drupal is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the URL for voting. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request, causing the victim to cast a vote pre-determined by the attacker. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning and other malicious activities.Refer to DRUPAL-SA-CONTRIB-2009-010 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1039.title: CDex ogg buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1039.body: CDex is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when processing Ogg Vorbis Info headers. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .ogg file containing a malformed Info header, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1040.title: WinAsm Studio .wap file buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1040.body: WinAsm Studio is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when handling .wap files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .wap file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1069.title: Content Construction Kit (CCK) module for Drupal node and user references cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1069.body: The Content Construction Kit (CCK) module for Drupal is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the node edit form feature. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using titles of candidate-referenced nodes or names of candidate-referenced users to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to DRUPAL-SA-CONTRIB-2009-013 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1070.title: ExpressionEngine avatar cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1070.body: ExpressionEngine is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the system/index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the avatar parameter to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of ExpressionEngine (1.6.7 or later), available from the ExpressionEngine Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1084.title: Sun Java System Identity Manager (IdM) System Configuration object unspecified
CVE-2009-1084.body: An unspecified vulnerability in the Sun Java System Identity Manager (IdM) related to modifying the System Configuration object could allow a remote authenticated attacker to have unknown impact.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 253267 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1087.title: PPLive multiple URI handler code execution
CVE-2009-1087.body: PPLive, when used in conjunction with Microsoft Internet Explorer, could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper validation of user supplied input to the synacast://, Play://, pplsv://, and ppvod:// URI handlers. By persuading a victim to click on a specially-crafted URI, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the LoadModule parameter to execute arbitrary code on the system via a .dll file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1088.title: Cascade Server XLST command execution
CVE-2009-1088.body: Cascade Server could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by an error when processing Extensible Stylesheet Language Transformation (XLST) stylesheets. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using xalan://java.lang.Runtime to execute arbitrary commands on the system with the privileges of the victim.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1089.title: Rapid Leech filename parameter information disclosure
CVE-2009-1089.body: Rapid Leech could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper validation of user supplied input to the filename parameter. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability via a direct request to download arbitrary files.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1091.title: Rapid Leech upload.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1091.body: Rapid Leech is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the upload.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1092.title: GeoVision LiveAudio ActiveX control denial of service
CVE-2009-1092.body: The GeoVision LiveAudio ActiveX Control (LIVEAUDIO.LiveAudioCtrl.1) could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a use-after-free vulnerability. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page, a remote attacker could use certain arguments to invoke the insecure GetAudioPlayingTime() method to execute arbitrary code on the system and cause the victim's browser to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1097.title: Sun Java Runtime Environment GIF file buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1097.body: Sun Java Runtime Environment (JRE) is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when processing GIF image files. By persuading a victim to visit a Web page containing an untrusted Java Web Start application, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with privileges of the victim or cause the browser to crash.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 254571 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1106.title: Sun Java Runtime Environment Java Plug-in crossdomain.xml information disclosure
CVE-2009-1106.body: Sun Java Runtime Environment (JRE) could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions, caused by improper handling of crossdomain.xml files by the Java Plug-in. By persuading a victim to load a specially-crafted Java applet, a remote attacker could bypass same-origin policy restrictions to gain unauthorized access to other domains providing an crossdomain.xml file and obtain sensitive information from the vulnerable system.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 254611 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1137.title: Microsoft PowerPoint sound data code execution
CVE-2009-1137.body: Microsoft PowerPoint could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error when handling sound data within PowerPoint files. By persuading a victim to open a malicious PowerPoint 4.0 file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References. — OR — Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2009-1162.title: Cisco IronPort AsyncOS referrer parameter cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1162.body: Cisco IronPort AsyncOS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Spam Quarantine login page. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the referrer parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade your hardware with the latest version of IronPort AsyncOS (6.5.2 or later), available from the Cisco Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1169.title: Multiple Mozilla products txMozillaXSLTProcessor::TransformToDoc() XSLT code execution
CVE-2009-1169.body: Mozilla Firefox and SeaMonkey could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an unspecified vulnerability in the txMozillaXSLTProcessor::TransformToDoc() function when processing an XSLT transform. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the browser to crash.Refer to MFSA 2009-12 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1187.title: Poppler JBIG2 decoder CairoOutputDev.cc code execution
CVE-2009-1187.body: Poppler could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an integer overflow in CairoOutputDev.cc in the JBIG2 decoder. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PDF file, an attacker could execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges or cause the affected application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Poppler (0.10.6 or later), available from the Poppler Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1188.title: Poppler JBIG2 decoder SplashBitmap.cc code execution
CVE-2009-1188.body: Poppler could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an integer overflow in SplashBitmap.cc in the JBIG2 decoder. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PDF file, an attacker could execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges or cause the affected application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Poppler (0.10.6 or later), available from the Poppler Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1189.title: D-Bus _dbus_validate_signature_with_reason() function (dbus-marshal-validate.c) spoofing
CVE-2009-1189.body: D-Bus is vulnerable to spoofing attacks. The _dbus_validate_signature_with_reason() function (dbus-marshal-validate.c) uses incorrect logic to validate a basic type. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted key to spoof a signature.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1190.title: Spring Framework data denial of service
CVE-2009-1190.body: Spring Framework is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper handling of serialized data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using regular expression strings containing an overly large amount of optional groups to consume all available CPU resources, resulting in a denial of service.Refer to SpringSource Security Advisory for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1191.title: Apache mod_proxy_ajp information disclosure
CVE-2009-1191.body: Apache could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the improper handling of malformed POST requests by mod_proxy_ajp. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to disclose response data and other sensitive information.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (modules/proxy/mod_proxy_ajp.c), available from the Apache Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1196.title: CUPS Scheduler Directory Services denial of service
CVE-2009-1196.body: CUPS is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a pointer use-after-delete error in the Scheduler Directory Services. By sending specially-crafted CUPS browse packets, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the cupsd daemon to crash.Refer to RHSA-2009-1083 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1208.title: Auth2DB unspecified SQL injection
CVE-2009-1208.body: Auth2DB is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements using multibyte character encodings, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Auth2DB (0.2.7 or later), available from the Auth2DB Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1209.title: Amaya multiple HTML tags buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1209.body: Amaya Web browser is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking of HTML tags. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability via a script tag with a long defer attribute to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1213.title: Bugzilla attachment.cgi cross-site request forgery
CVE-2009-1213.body: Bugzilla is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the attachment.cgi script. By persuading an authenticated victim to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted HTTP request to submit attachments or perform other arbitrary actions. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Upgrade to the latest version of Bugzilla (3.2.3 or 3.3.4 or later), available from the Bugzilla Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1214.title: GNU Screen /tmp/screen-exchange information disclosure
CVE-2009-1214.body: GNU Screen could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the creation of the /tmp/screen-exchange temporary file with insecure permissions. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1220.title: Cisco ASA 5520 WebVPN cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1220.body: Cisco ASA 5520 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting in the WebVPN clientless mode feature, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.html page. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability via the Host HTTP header to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, allowing the attacker to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1228.title: Arcade Script CMS register.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1228.body: Arcade Script CMS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the register.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the username field to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1229.title: Arcadwy Arcade Script user SQL injection
CVE-2009-1229.body: Arcadwy Arcade Script is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the login script using the user cookie parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1232.title: Mozilla Firefox XML denial of service
CVE-2009-1232.body: Mozilla Firefox is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper parsing of XML documents. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted XML document containing an overly large number of nested elements, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the browser to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1233.title: Apple Safari XML denial of service
CVE-2009-1233.body: Apple Safari is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper parsing of XML documents. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted XML document containing an overly large number of nested A elements, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the browser to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1234.title: Opera XML denial of service
CVE-2009-1234.body: Opera is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper parsing of XML documents. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted XML document containing a long series of start-tags with no corresponding end-tags, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the browser to crash.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1239.title: IBM DB2 predicate information disclosure
CVE-2009-1239.body: IBM DB2 could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the return of incorrect query results related to the order of application for an INNER JOIN predicate and an OUTER JOIN predicate. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted query to obtain sensitive information.Refer to IBM APAR JR31886 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For IBM products: Refer to the appropriate IBM Security Bulletin for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system.

CVE-2009-1242.title: Linux Kernel EFER_LME denial of service
CVE-2009-1242.body: Linux Kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the failure to verify if EFER_LME is set in the vmx_set_msr() function. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized access to EFER and cause a kernel OOPS.Upgrade to the latest version of Linux Kernel (2.6.29 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1243.title: Linux Kernel /proc/net/udp denial of service
CVE-2009-1243.body: Linux Kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the /proc/net/udp file related to the udp seq_file infrastructure. By reading zero bytes, a local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a kernel panic.Upgrade to the latest version of Linux Kernel (2.6.29 -git8 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1245.title: CCCP Community Code Pastebin php/cccp-pages/submit.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-1245.body: CCCP Community Code Pastebin is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the php/cccp-pages/submit.php script using the subject, language or nickname parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of CCCP Community Code Pastebin (2.80 or later), available from SourceForge.net: Files. See References.

CVE-2009-1246.title: blogplus multiple scripts file and theme parameter file include
CVE-2009-1246.body: blogplus could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the block_center_down.php, block_center_top.php, block_left.php, block_right.php, window_down.php or window_top.php script using the file or theme parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1247.title: Acute Control Panel login.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-1247.body: Acute Control Panel is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the login.php script using the username parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1248.title: Acute Control Panel theme_directory file include
CVE-2009-1248.body: Acute Control Panel could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the container.php or header.php script using the theme_directory parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1287.title: Cisco Subscriber Edge Services Manager (SESM) cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1287.body: Cisco Subscriber Edge Services Manager (SESM) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1291.title: TIBCO SmartSockets RTserver UDP buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1291.body: TIBCO SmartSockets RTserver is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when processing UDP requests. By sending a specially-crafted UDP request, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with SYSTEM privileges or cause the server to crash. Note: This vulnerability also affects TIBCO RTworks and TIBCO Enterprise Message Service.For TIBCO SmartSockets: Upgrade to the latest version of TIBCO SmartSockets (6.8.2 or later), as listed in TIBCO Software Inc. Security Advisory April 28, 2009. See References. For TIBCO RTworks: Upgrade to the latest version of TIBCO RTworks (4.0.5 or later), as listed in TIBCO Software Inc. Security Advisory April 28, 2009. See References. For TIBCO Enterprise Message Service: Upgrade to the latest version of TIBCO EMS (5.1.2 or later), as listed in TIBCO Software Inc. Security Advisory April 28, 2009. See References.

CVE-2009-1292.title: IBM Rational ClearCase UCM-CQ information disclosure
CVE-2009-1292.body: IBM Rational ClearCase could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the storing of login credentials in plaintext by UCM-CQ running on Linux or AIX. By executing the "ps -ef" command, a local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to disclose the username and password and other sensitive information.Refer to IBM APAR PK75832 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1296.title: eCryptfs (ecryptfs-utils) passphrase information disclosure
CVE-2009-1296.body: eCryptfs (ecryptfs-utils) could allow an attacker to obtain sensitive information. If the eCryptfs home directory is selected as the location for the installation files, the mount passphrase is stored unprotected in the root directory. A local attacker with root privileges could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive password information from the log files.Refer to Ubuntu Security Notice USN-783-1 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1315.title: AbleSpace adv_cat.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1315.body: AbleSpace is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the adv_cat.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the find_str, cat_id, or razd_id parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1318.title: Jamroom index.php file include
CVE-2009-1318.body: Jamroom could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the "t" parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1321.title: ASP Product Catalog seach.asp cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1321.body: ASP Product Catalog is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the search.asp script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the keywords parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1323.title: WebFileExplorer body.asp SQL injection
CVE-2009-1323.body: WebFileExplorer is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the body.asp script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1325.title: Mini-stream Ripper .M3U buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1325.body: Mini-stream Ripper is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when parsing malicious .M3U files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .M3U file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1327.title: WM Downloader .M3U buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1327.body: WM Downloader is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when parsing malicious .M3U files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .M3U file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1328.title: Mini-stream RM-MP3 Converter .M3U buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1328.body: Mini-stream RM-MP3 Converter is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when parsing malicious .M3U files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .M3U file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1330.title: Mini-stream Easy RM to MP3 Converter .pls buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1330.body: Mini-stream Easy RM to MP3 Converter is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when parsing malicious .pls files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .pls file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1333.title: HP Deskjet 6840 refresh_rate.htm cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1333.body: HP Deskjet 6840 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by refresh_rate.htm. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a POST request to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1334.title: IBM Tivoli Continuous Data Protection for Files reason parameter cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1334.body: IBM Tivoli Continuous Data Protection for Files is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the FilepathLogin.html page. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the reason parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1338.title: Linux kernel kill_something_info() function security bypass
CVE-2009-1338.body: Linux kernel could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error in the kill_something_info() function when considering PID namespace signal processing to PID -1. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the kill command to bypass the intended namespace isolation and send arbitrary signals to all processes in all namespaces.Upgrade to the latest version of the Linux kernel (2.6.28 or later), available from the Linux Kernel Archives Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1341.title: libdbd-pg-perl dequote_bytea() function denial of service
CVE-2009-1341.body: libdbd-pg-perl is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a memory leak error in the dequote_bytea() function. By fetching data with BYTEA columns, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the consumption of all memory resources.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1345.title: cpCommerce document.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-1345.body: cpCommerce is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the document.php script using the id_document parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of cpCommerce (1.2.7 or later), available from the cpCommerce Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1346.title: NetHoteles ficha.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-1346.body: NetHoteles is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the ficha.php script using the id_establecimiento parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1352.title: PowerCHM url buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1352.body: PowerCHM is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking in HTML files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .HTML file containing an overly long url, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1354.title: Mongoose directory traversal
CVE-2009-1354.body: Mongoose could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. By sending a specially-crafted URL request containing "dot dot" sequences (/../), a remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability to view arbitrary files on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1357.title: Sun Java System Delegated Administrator /da/DA/Login HTTP response splitting
CVE-2009-1357.body: Sun Java System Delegated Administrator is vulnerable to HTTP response splitting attacks, caused by improper validation of input passed to /da/DA/Login. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the HELP_PAGE parameter in a specially-crafted URL to inject arbitrary HTTP headers and cause the server to return a split response, once the URL is clicked. This would allow the attacker to perform further attacks, such as Web cache poisoning, cross-site scripting, and other malicious activity.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 255928 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1362.title: chCounter administration/index.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-1362.body: chCounter is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the administration/index.php script using the login_name parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1367.title: moziloCMS index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1367.body: moziloCMS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the query parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1368.title: moziloCMS index.php file include
CVE-2009-1368.body: moziloCMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the page parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1369.title: moziloCMS index.php path disclosure
CVE-2009-1369.body: moziloCMS could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. An attacker could send a direct URL request to the index.php, gallery.php or download.php script to cause an error message to be returned containing the full installation path. An attacker could use this information to launch further attacks against the affected system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1370.title: Video Converter Wizard .cue file buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1370.body: Video Converter Wizard is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when parsing malicious .cue files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .cue playlist file containing an overly long entry, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1375.title: Pidgin PurpleCircBuffer denial of service
CVE-2009-1375.body: Pidgin is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by improper bounds checking by the PurpleCircBuffer structure. By sending specially-crafted XMPP or Sametime packets, a remote attacker could corrupt memory and cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Pidgin (2.5.6 or later), available from the Pidgin Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1376.title: Pidgin MSN SLP buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1376.body: Pidgin is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when processing MSN SLP messages. By sending specially-crafted MSN SLP messages, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash. Note: Adium is also affected by this vulnerability.Upgrade to the latest version of Pidgin (2.5.6 or later), available from the Pidgin Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1379.title: OpenSSL dtls1_retrieve_buffered_fragment denial of service
CVE-2009-1379.body: OpenSSL is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a use-after-free vulnerability in the dtls1_retrieve_buffered_fragment function. By sending a specially-crafted DTLS packet, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (retrieve_buffered_fragment.patch), available from RT for openssl.org ticket #1923. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1380.title: JBoss Enterprise Application Platform JMX Console cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1380.body: JBoss Enterprise Application Platform is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the JMX Console. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the filter parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1382.title: mimeTeX mimetex.cgi buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1382.body: mimeTeX is vulnerable to multiple stack-based buffer overflows, caused by improper bounds checking by the mimetex.cgi script. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted TeX file with an overly long picture, circle, or input tags, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.mimeTeX customers should contact mimeTeX support for upgrade or patch information. See References.

CVE-2009-1383.title: mathTeX getdirective command execution
CVE-2009-1383.body: mathTeX could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by an error in the getdirective function in the mathtex.cgi script. By sending a specially-crafted request containing shell metacharacters in the dpi tag, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands on the system.mathTeX customers should contact mimeTeX support for upgrade or patch information. See References.

CVE-2009-1389.title: Linux Kernel RTL8169 NIC denial of service
CVE-2009-1389.body: Linux Kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper handling of packets by RTL8169 NIC. By sending an overly large number of packets, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the system to crash. Note: This vulnerability also affects other products.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Linux Kernel GIT Repository. See References. For other distributions: Contact your vendor for upgrade or patch information.

CVE-2009-1391.title: Compress::Raw::Zlib module for Perl inflate() function buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1391.body: The Compress::Raw::Zlib module for Perl is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by an off-by-one error in the inflate() function. By persuading a victim to open a .zip file containing a specially-crafted zlib-stream, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the affected application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Compress::Raw::Zlib (2.017 or later), available from the Paul Marquess Compress-Raw-Zlib Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1404.title: PastelCMS admin.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-1404.body: PastelCMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the admin.php script using the Username field, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1405.title: PastelCMS set_lng file include
CVE-2009-1405.body: PastelCMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request using the set_lng parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1406.title: TotalCalendar cms_detect.php file include
CVE-2009-1406.body: TotalCalendar could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the cms_detect.php script using the include parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1407.title: NotFTP config.php file include
CVE-2009-1407.body: NotFTP could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the config.php script using the newlang parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1408.title: webSPELL BBCode cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1408.body: webSPELL is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using BBCode to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of webSPELL (4.04d or later), available from the webSPELL Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1409.title: e107 hide parameter SQL injection
CVE-2009-1409.body: e107 is vulnerable to SQL injection. If Extended User Fields are activated, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the usersettings.php script using the hide parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1410.title: Quick.CMS.Lite index.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-1410.body: Quick.CMS.Lite is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1411.title: Events plugin for Seditio CMS events.inc.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-1411.body: The Events plugin for Seditio CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the events.inc.php script using the "c" parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1412.title: Google Chrome chromehtml: protocol handler command execution
CVE-2009-1412.body: Google Chrome could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by an argument injection vulnerability in the chromehtml: protocol handler. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a Web page that sets document.location to a chromehtml: value to determine file existence and open tabs for URLs that do not satisfy the IsWebSafeScheme restriction.Upgrade to the latest version of Google Chrome (1.0.154.59 or later), available from the Google Chrome Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1413.title: Google Chrome setTimeout cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1413.body: Google Chrome is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by the failure to cancel timeouts upon a page transition. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by invoking setTimeout and modifying document.location to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1414.title: Google Chrome global object cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1414.body: Google Chrome is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by modifications to the global object across a page transition. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unspecified attack vectors to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1455.title: WebCollab unspecified cross-site request forgery
CVE-2009-1455.body: WebCollab is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted HTTP request to modify a user's password. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Upgrade to the latest version of WebCollab (2.50 or later), available from SourceForge.net: Files Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1457.title: Nuke Evolution Xtreme player.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1457.body: Nuke Evolution Xtreme is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the player.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the defaultVisualExt in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1458.title: razorCMS index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1458.body: razorCMS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the slab, catname or cat parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of razorCMS (0.4 or later), available from the morgan integrated systems Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1459.title: razorCMS unspecified cross-site request forgery
CVE-2009-1459.body: razorCMS is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading an authenticated user to visit a malicious Web site, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted HTTP request to create pages containing arbitrary PHP code. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Upgrade to the latest version of razorCMS (0.4 or later), available from the morgan integrated systems Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1460.title: razorCMS admin_config.php information disclosure
CVE-2009-1460.body: razorCMS could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper restrictions on the admin_config.php file stored inside the Web root. By sending a direct request, a remote attacker could obtain sensitive information, which could be used to launch further attacks against the affected system.Upgrade to the latest version of razorCMS (0.4 or later), available from the morgan integrated systems Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1461.title: razorCMS Create New Page cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1461.body: razorCMS is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Create New Page form. A remote authenticated attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the Page Title field to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of razorCMS (0.4 or later), available from the Morgan Integrated Systems Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1462.title: razorCMS Security Manager unspecified
CVE-2009-1462.body: An unspecified vulnerability in razorCMS related to the failure to verify file permissions of the apache user account by the Security Manager could be exploited by a local attacker to have an unknown impact on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of razorCMS (0.4 or later), available from the Morgan Integrated Systems Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1463.title: razorCMS .php file code execution
CVE-2009-1463.body: razorCMS could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system. By saving data as a .php file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary PHP code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of razorCMS (0.4 or later), available from the Morgan Integrated Systems Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1466.title: Application Access Server (A-A-S) aas.ini information disclosure
CVE-2009-1466.body: Application Access Server (A-A-S) could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. The passwords and the port keyword are stored in aas.ini in cleartext. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1467.title: IceWarp Merak Mail Server WebMail cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1467.body: IceWarp Merak Mail Server is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Email view or RSS feed reader in the WebMail component. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using emails or RSS feeds to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Merak Mail Server (9.4.2 or later), available from the IceWarp Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1469.title: IceWarp Merak Mail Server Forgot Password header injection
CVE-2009-1469.body: IceWarp Merak Mail Server is vulnerable to header injection, caused by an error in the Forgot Password function that generates email messages sent by the server on the client side. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP POST request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject arbitrary headers and content into the email messages sent by the Forgot Password feature, which will allow the attacker to conduct various attacks against the vulnerable system and obtain user credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Merak Mail Server (9.4.2 or later), available from the IceWarp Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1473.title: ATEN KH1516i and KN9116 IP KVM switch Windows and Java client RSA cryptography weak security
CVE-2009-1473.body: The ATEN KH1516i and KN9116 IP KVM switch could provide weaker than expected security, caused by improper use of RSA cryptography in the Windows and Java client during symmetric session-key negotiation. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to conduct man-in-the-middle attacks or decrypt network traffic.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1474.title: ATEN KH1516i and KN9116 IP KVM switch mouse events weak security
CVE-2009-1474.body: The ATEN KH1516i and KN9116 IP KVM switch could provide weaker than expected security, caused by the lack of encryption of mouse events and the failure to set the secure flag for the session cookie in an https session. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using man-in-the-middle techniques to perform unauthorized mouse operations or capture session cookies.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1476.title: IPFilter load_http.c buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1476.body: IPFilter is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by load_http.c. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP GET request containing an overly long string, a local attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with kernel-level privileges or cause the application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the CVS Repository. See References.

CVE-2009-1477.title: ATEN KH1516i and KN9116 IP KVM switch and PN9108 power-control unit SSL key weak security
CVE-2009-1477.body: The ATEN KH1516i and KN9116 IP KVM switch and the PN9108 power-control unit could provide weaker than expected security, caused by the use of a hardcoded SSL private key. By extracting the SSL key and sniffing network traffic, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to decrypt https sessions.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1479.title: Boxalino default.htm directory traversal
CVE-2009-1479.body: Boxalino could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the default.htm script containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the url parameter to view arbitrary files on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of Boxalino (09.05.25-0421 or later), available from the Boxalino Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1482.title: MoinMoin error_msg cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1482.body: MoinMoin is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the action/AttachFile.py script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an AttachFile sub-action in the error_msg function or multiple vectors related to package file errors in the upload_form function to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Apply the fix for this vulnerability, available from the MoinMoin Mercurial Repository. See References.

CVE-2009-1487.title: FunGamez login.php SQL injection
CVE-2009-1487.body: FunGamez is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the login.php script using the username parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1488.title: FunGamez load.php file include
CVE-2009-1488.body: FunGamez could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote authenticated attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the load.php script using the module parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1489.title: Fungamez includes/user.php authentication bypass
CVE-2009-1489.body: Fungamez could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper validation of authentication cookies by the includes/user.php script. By modifying the user cookie parameter, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and gain unauthorized administrative access to the vulnerable application.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1490.title: Sendmail X- header buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1490.body: Sendmail is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow. By sending an overly long X- header, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the daemon to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Sendmail (8.13.2 or later), available from the Sendmail Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1492.title: Adobe Reader and Acrobat getAnnots() code execution
CVE-2009-1492.body: Adobe Reader and Acrobat could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error when processing calls to the getAnnots() JavaScript method in in the JavaScript API. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PDF file that contains an annotation and has an OpenAction entry with JavaScript code, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Refer to APSB09-06 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1493.title: Adobe Reader and Acrobat spell.customDictionaryOpen() code execution
CVE-2009-1493.body: Adobe Reader and Acrobat could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error when processing calls to the customDictionaryOpen() JavaScript method the JavaScript API. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PDF file that triggers a call to this method with a long string in the second argument, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Refer to APSB09-06 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1498.title: iDB inc/profilemain.php file include
CVE-2009-1498.body: iDB could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the inc/profilemain.php script using the skin parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote or the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code using a local file, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1505.title: The News Page module for Drupal keywords SQL injection
CVE-2009-1505.body: The News Page module for Drupal is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker with privileges to create and edit News Page nodes could send specially-crafted SQL statements using the keywords parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Refer to DRUPAL-SA-CONTRIB-2009-023 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1508.title: X-Forum cookie_username SQL injection
CVE-2009-1508.body: X-Forum is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the configure.php script using the cookie_username parameter when the admin nickname is known, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1512.title: X-Forum Config.php code execution
CVE-2009-1512.body: X-Forum could allow a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Config.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the adminEMail parameter to inject and execute arbitrary PHP code on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1520.title: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager (TSM) Web GUI buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1520.body: IBM Tivoli Storage Manager (TSM) is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the Web GUI. By using unknown attack vectors, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Apply the appropriate update for your system, available from IBM Support & downloads. See References.

CVE-2009-1525.title: DirectAdmin CMD_DB command execution
CVE-2009-1525.body: DirectAdmin could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by the improper validation of user-supplied input. By sending a specially-crafted request using the name parameter containing shell metacharacters, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary shell commands with root privileges on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of DirectAdmin (1.33.4 or later), available from the DirectAdmin Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1550.title: ABC Advertise admin.inc.php information disclosure
CVE-2009-1550.body: ABC Advertise could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper restrictions on the admin.inc.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain the username and password and other sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1553.title: Sun GlassFish Enterprise Server Administration Interface cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1553.body: Sun GlassFish Enterprise Server (formerly Sun Java System Application Server 9.1UR2) is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Administration Interface. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 258528 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1554.title: Project Woodstock 404 Page cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1554.body: Project Woodstock is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of UTF-7 encoded input when handling a 404 Page Not Found error. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Woodstock CVS Repository. See References.

CVE-2009-1557.title: Linksys WVC54GCA next_file cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1557.body: Linksys WVC54GCA is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the img/main.cgi, main.cgi, and adm/file.cgi scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the next_file parameter or the this_file parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1558.title: Linksys WVC54GCA /adm/file.cgi directory traversal
CVE-2009-1558.body: Linksys WVC54GCA could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the /adm/file.cgi script containing URL-encoded "dot dot" sequences (%2f%2e.%2f) in the next_file parameter to view arbitrary files on the device.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1559.title: Linksys WVC54GCA /adm/file.cgi directory traversal
CVE-2009-1559.body: Linksys WVC54GCA could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the /adm/file.cgi script containing URL-encoded "dot dot" sequences (%2f%2e.%2f) in the next_file parameter to view arbitrary files on the device.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1560.title: Linksys WVC54GCA pass_wd.htm and Wsecurity.htm information disclosure
CVE-2009-1560.body: Linksys WVC54GCA could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the storing of passwords and wireless-network keys in cleartext within pass_wd.htm and Wsecurity.htm. By reading the HTML source code, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1566.title: Roxio Creator image code execution
CVE-2009-1566.body: Roxio Creator could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an integer overflow error when processing images. By persuading a victim to open a malicious image file containing specially-crafted dimensions, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (Creator 2010 SP1), available from the Roxio Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1570.title: GIMP ReadImage() buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1570.body: GIMP is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by an integer overflow in the ReadImage() function. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted BMP file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the GNOME GIT Repository. See References.

CVE-2009-1571.title: Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey HTML parser code execution
CVE-2009-1571.body: Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a use-after-free error in the HTML parser. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the browser to crash.Refer to MFSA 2010-03 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1575.title: Drupal UTF-7 cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1575.body: Drupal is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using UTF-8 byte sequences before the Content-Type meta tag in a post to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to SA-CORE-2009-005 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2009-1577.title: Cscope find.c buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1577.body: Cscope is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the find.c script. By sending a specially-crafted file containing an overly long function, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Cscope (15.7a or later), available from the Cscope Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1578.title: SquirrelMail decrypt_headers.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1578.body: SquirrelMail is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the decrypt_headers.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of SquirrelMail (1.4.18 or later), available from the SquirrelMail Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1578.title: SquirrelMail PHP_SELF and QUERY_STRING cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1578.body: SquirrelMail is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the PHP_SELF and QUERY_STRING server environment variables. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of SquirrelMail (1.4.18 or later), available from the SquirrelMail Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1579.title: SquirrelMail map_yp_alias code execution
CVE-2009-1579.body: SquirrelMail could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error in the map_yp_alias username mapping functionality. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability via unsanitized shell commands to execute arbitrary code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of SquirrelMail (1.4.18 or later), available from the SquirrelMail Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1580.title: SquirrelMail $base_uri session hijacking
CVE-2009-1580.body: SquirrelMail could allow a remote attacker to hijack a valid user's session, caused by improper generation of the $base_uri variable during page requests. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by creating a specially-crafted Web page containing a malicious session ID value to hijack a victim's session and gain the victim's privileges, if the attacker could persuade the victim to visit a malicious Web page and login to the affected application.Upgrade to the latest version of SquirrelMail (1.4.18 or later), available from the SquirrelMail Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1581.title: SquirrelMail mime.php CSS positioning cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1581.body: SquirrelMail is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by mime.php. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using CSS positioning in a specially-crafted email to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of SquirrelMail (1.4.18 or later), available from the SquirrelMail Web site. See References. For other distributions: Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2009-1582.title: Million Dollar Text Links admin.home.php authentication bypass
CVE-2009-1582.body: Million Dollar Text Links could allow a remote attacker to bypass the authentication process, caused by improper restrictions on the admin.home.php script. By sending a direct request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass the authentication process and perform administrative actions.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1583.title: TemaTres term cross-site scripting
CVE-2009-1583.body: TemaTres is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input when editing a term. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of TemaTres (1.0.31 or later), available from the TemaTres Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1586.title: Grabit .NZB buffer overflow
CVE-2009-1586.body: Grabit is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the NZB importer feature. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .NZB file containing a DTD reference in a DOCTYPE element, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Grabit (1.7.2 beta 4 or later), available from the Grabit Web site. See References.

CVE-2009-1587.title: PHP Site Lock index.php security bypass
CVE-2009-1587.body: PHP Site Lock could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper validation of authentication cookies by the index.php script. By modifying various cookie parameters, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and gain unauthorized administrative access to the vulnerable application.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2009-1593.title: Armorlogic Profense blacklist security bypass
CVE-2009-1593.body: Armorlogic Profense could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-site scripting filters and launch cross-site scripting attacks against the system. If the system is configured for use with a negative model (blacklist approach), a remote attacker could inject additional characters in the JavaScript tag.
